item.title: Report E-2024050358
item.description:
Report E-2024050358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-22T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 2, 2024, two (2) half-gallon cans of corrosive liquid were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the cardboard boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized cleaners and absorbents to remediate the site and containerized all impacted materials and the damaged cans in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050312
item.description:
Report E-2024050312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: HAWAIIAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Event Details: • HA57 SAN-OGG 6APR24 @ approximately 830 am • During boarding, passenger approached Flight Attendant with a Amazon Kindle that was smoking • Flight attendant placed kindle in fire containment bag (AVSAC) and placed bag in the jetbridge • Item was contained in AVSAC and TSA, and SAN Harbor police were contacted. Once scene was clear flight was released. • SAN Harbor police retained the damaged/burnt kindle.

item.title: Report E-2024050270
item.description:
Report E-2024050270

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 ounces of Wet Look Green were released from one 5-gallon metal pail due to the lid appearing to have been popped open prior to arrival. The spilled amount only impacted the container, no surfaces were affected. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they felt comfortable cleaning the spill with the available personal protective equipment and placed the contents into a 30-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050269
item.description:
Report E-2024050269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 pints of Landau Top & Trim Adhesive were released from one 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by the terminal. The release impacted trailer #3213720. The release was completely dried upon arrival. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024050268
item.description:
Report E-2024050268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-27
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 6 ounces of Mark-It Printing Ink were released from (1) 5-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. The release impacted the cardboard only. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the personal protective equipment available on site.
